issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: new key and value instances are allocated before each map

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: If the map function reuses the key or value by destructively modifying it after the output.collect(key,value) call and your application uses a combiner, the data is corrupted by having lots of instances with the last key or value.
fields.summary: Reused Keys and Values fail with a Combiner

comments.body: The reason that new objects are allocated during map is so that new objects will be available for the combiner.  So fixing HADOOP-110 is easy, but HADOOP-2 must be fixed first, since it is the underlying problem.

This patch clones the keys and values before they are cached in the CombiningCollector.
It adds a new method named WritableUtils.clone(Writable, JobConf) that copies the the given Writable.
I just committed this.  Thanks Owen!
